title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 8.5
body:
https://i.imgur.com/F81h0d2.jpg

Hey everyone and welcome to Patch 8.5. We're entering the breach. Welcome to the Kai'Sa patch.

I’m Riot Novalas & I’m a QA Analyst on Riot’s Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who work on Core Gameplay playing new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they’re released. It’s our job to test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we’re introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun.

Patch Chat serves as an opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks.
You can find information on the most recent patch by following this link:
https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-85-notes

Our newest friend on the rift is the daughter of the Void, Kai'Sa! With multiple buildpaths and different play patterns, Kai'Sa is one of the more diverse champions that have been introduced in recent memory. The primary playtesters for Kai'Sa were Madness Heroo & ROBERTxLEE. Feel free to ask any and all (gameplay) void-related questions and we'll be happy to give you insight!

Aside from Kai'Sa, we've got some buffs and nerfs to various champions; Nocturne, Swain, Rengar, and Zoe got some love. Azir, Galio, and Volibear took some nerfs. 

Ask us ANYTHING about 8.5. We're here to answer questions about your favorite champions, inquiries about runes, or maybe how often we execute to jungle camps! Let's talk bot lane matchups or maybe discuss shifts in the jungle! We're also down to just chat, though.

Disclaimer: We have no insight on upcoming/future skins.

Chris “Auberaun” Roberts
Christy “Riot Ender L” Frierson
Nick “Riot Endstep” Frijia
Sigmundur “GangIeri” Helgason
Arnor “Riot Hjarta” Halldorsson
Rob “Riot King Cobra” Rosa
Miktat “Riot Koyuncu” Koyuncu
Brian “Riot Madness Heroo” Pressoir
Nabi “Riot Novalas” Barak
Dan “Riot penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee

replies.body:
Why does Phantom Dancer and Statiks cost 2600g?

My Bruiser ITEMS : Trinity + Steraks + Hydra = 3733 + 3100 + 3500

VS the best scaling late game class ADC:
2600 +2600 + 3400



Just why? Why can't Bruiser have cheap items
Personally believe there is a lot of space for cheaper bruiser items. That said, I'm firmly in the "ADC itemization is too cheap" camp.

>Personally believe there is a lot of space for cheaper bruiser items. 

I'll have to strongly disagree here. I personally think bruiser items are extremely good. Every single item you buy is independently very power so they should cost they they cost now.

>That said, I'm firmly in the "ADC itemization is too cheap" camp.

This I agree. I think after ADC items are made more expensive, we'll see that mage/tank/brusier/adc items are all appropriately priced.

I didn't mean that I would like current bruiser items to be lower costed, but just that I think there is additional space for more interesting mid-tier options (which is kind of a lame "I think there are more possibilities!" nonanswer).

I think changing the amount of waveclear ADCs will have access to will slow their curves substantially. I'm excited.
It's kinda weird, not bad weird, almost good weird, that "little" changes like that and blast cones can alter class balance.
I think it's wildly interesting. It makes me happy in all the right dweeb places.

The "bruiser items are too expensive" argument is pretty inane to me - the items are more expensive because they're better items. Granted I do think that ADC itemization is too cheap right now, but realistically bruiser items could cost twice as much as ADC items and be balanced if the items were cost-efficient enough. Relative cost is not a sensible way to compare items since it's meaningless without the context of item efficiency - Sterak's is just a more efficient item than all the Zeal upgrades, so comparing them 1:1 and saying that the Zeal items are better because they're cheaper doesn't make sense.

Again though, I do agree ADC itemization is too cheap but that's a separate issue - ADCs spike very fast and get their multipliers early in the game, that doesn't mean that bruisers should be able to do the same thing.

I feel like this is true if you completely ignore item passive and actives.

The thing is that completed items have large bonuses that component items don't, so if ADCs can get 3 in the same time as fighters get 2 they have an advantage even if the stats equal out just due to their extra passive.
Of course the more expensive item needs to be more cost-efficient for this to work out, but that's generally true already with most items on Live.

Are fighter items really more cost efficient? Let's ignore Sterak's for a moment because it's gold efficiency varies radically depending on base AD and look at the other item I'd say most people would consider to be the prototypical bruiser item, Titanic Hydra.

Hydra's gold efficiency before its passive is 86.43% before its passive while PD is 97.02% and SS is 87.4%. I don't see the idea behind this argument, Titanic is already less gold efficient before you even consider that it has a junk-stat in HP regen on it, comparatively SS/PD have crit, probably the most undercosted stat in the game.

I'd say the prototypical bruiser items are Black Cleaver and Triforce before Titanic, but Titanic's not a bad example. 

Using the gold efficiency of the raw stats on items is a good place to start, but I think it'd be pretty absurd to say that Titanic's passive and active are worth less gold than PD's passive. Even in just the on-hit damage on the initial target you're looking at 20-30+ damage per AA, which is 700-1050+ gold worth of damage if compared to Longsword (though obviously it's slightly worse than AD in most cases since it doesn't scale AD ratios but there isn't a good comparison point for pure on-hit damage). That's not even including the cleave and AA reset with additional damage on it. PD's passive is worth quite a bit of gold as well but it's hard to make a direct comparison there given that these effects are so variable in their value. 

That said, I'd find it hard to justify an argument that the passive on PD is worth anywhere near as much as even just the passive effect on Titanic, given how powerful the on-hit and the cleave is, plus it also has an active which is quite powerful (worth a fair amount of gold by itself). Titanic's value is also much more reliable than PD's which in and of itself increases the value - reliable stats are just going to be better than inconsistent ones, I would say the PD passive is more situational than Titanic.

>Again though, I do agree ADC itemization is too cheap but that's a separate issue - ADCs spike very fast and get their multipliers early in the game, that doesn't mean that bruisers should be able to do the same thing.

I think it's that the multiplier of critical strike is too powerful. Past a certain threshold it's by far the most dominating combination of items and will beat anything else.

I'd rather see you guys decrease the effectiveness ceiling of crit and keep the cost of those items low. ADC who have to wait 25minutes+ to have an impact on the game just feel terrible to play, at least in solo queue. 

Basically, I think ADC should be less powerful late game and more powerful early game. So they're not mandatory to secure late game wins and feel better to play all game long.

I do agree we shouldn't go back to the state of the game where ADCs have little relevance on one item and only "turn on" at 2+ items - we've seen that world before and it was not a great place. That said, not sure if crit is the place to hit - there's been some discussion about what shifting that power around looks like, not all of it about crit. 

Specifically on making ADC power curves more flat, personally I'm of the opinion that one item ADs are too strong right now and that flattening their power curve would only make the game even more botlane centric than it is right now.

I've recently been campaigning for more melee/ranged splits on runes/items, but it's not something that's being explored specifically right now by any designers to the best of my knowledge. Given the success of melee/ranged splits on things like Wit's End and Sterak's, I imagine it's more likely that designers will look into that sort of change in the future but it's not something that anyone is actively looking at right now.
Does Cobra Play Kai' Sa  really aggressively?
yes, and he hopes you play aggressively too.

Are there any plans on changing Lucian to become a decent pick in the bot lane or new items that could help ad casters? Also, don’t u guys think hyper adc are reaching their power spikes a bit too early into the game?

Would definitely like to buff Lucian Bot. His buffs a couple patches ago were intended to do this (and did to some degree, though he's still weak). The issue is finding a way to buff Bot lane Lucian that doesn't push solo lane Lucian over the top, as he saw significant pro play Mid late last season despite being a sub 50% winrate champion in the role. Odds are he is closer to being viable solo lane than Bot, so we have to be very deliberate with how we buff him in order to make him strong bot and not oppressive Mid/Top. This is why we specifically buffed his crit scaling and reduced some of the level scaling last time around, as these affect bot lane Lucian more than solo lane.

Can anybody comment on the state of Ryze and why he was nerfed?

The patch notes state that the E change was intended to improve his early waveclear but I think it actually does the opposite (at rank 1 E splashes for 70/2=35 i stead of 50) and then it’s a strait up 50% nerf at rank 5.  I agree it is a little easier to kill directly with E at rank 1 (70dmg instead of 50) but this does’t even come close to offsetting the 50% splash nerf.

Also consider E splash nerf didn’t just nerf waveclear... the E splash was also a large source of lane poke.  This is huge.

And you nerfed Ryze who literally has the lowest win rate Top and Mid (with the exception of Zoe who was effectively disabled).

Meanwhile champs like Sion and Janna are left alone...

I just don’t get it.  Can anybody explain?

Ryze was nerfed due to being the largest beneficiary of the AP itemization other than Cassio. He just dominates high tiers of play and shuts out other champions. I personally think he'll be a problem child until we aggressively change {{item:3001}}, as negatron cloak mid lane items have proved problematic in the past.

Appreciate the response.  I agree with you the AP items were a huge boost for Ryze.  But it only took his overall win rate from like 42% --> 45%.

Do you think with the PBE Archangels Staff shield nerf & Abyssal Mask range changes that you will be able to revert Ryze's E nerf?  It just feels so bad on 8.5 when an enemy mispositions and you E a low health minion and it ricochet's to the enemy champ for... 30 damage.

I'd like to know what you mean by dominating high tiers of play.  I looked at win rates on 8.4 and Ryze (before the 8.5 nerfs) was...
Silver: 45% win rate (50% of playerbase)
Diamond: 49% win rate (top 1% of playerbase)

So I see he does get better at higher tiers of play... but 49% in diamond still doesn't warrant a nerf does it?  Unless by dominating high tiers of play you mean master/challenger/pro?  In which case I'd ask why the the rest of us 99.9% of the player base (Bronze-Diamond who average ~45% win rate on Ryze) should get nerfs because of 0.1% of the playerbase (master/challenger/pro)?

Besides even if the pro's pick Ryze a lot... his Realm Warp makes for some interesting LCS highlight reels :P

> Do you think with the PBE Archangels Staff shield nerf & Abyssal Mask range changes that you will be able to revert Ryze's E nerf?

We'll always be looking out for champions that need follow up after itemization changes. I can't promise anything in terms of reversion, but I'd be surprised if we didn't look into more Ryze stuff in the future.
How do you guys feel about Kai'Sa's snowball potential vs. her usefulness when behind?

She is certainly a much more powerful champion from ahead, as a lot of her Ultimate's power is in making aggressive plays. She has some usefulness from behind, primarily if you go more of a tank busting build via botrk/rageblade and make use of her passive's execute damage to still deal meaningful damage to the frontline. That being said I'd say she's certainly one of the weaker ADC's when behind, as is often the case for any ADC with little or no utility.

I have one more question:

Did you guys playtest her effectiveness with a low cc and vs a high CC team?
How did she feel?

Asking since the spotlight vid seemed kinda loaded with cc champs so wondering if there were more "normal" playtests with her and how the Kai'Sa player felt during those kind of games.

Spotlight showed:

(Kai'Sa/Maokai/Xerath/Thresh/Vi) vs. Graves Nami Jhin Vel

or

(Kai'Sa/Rakan/Vi/Jax) vs Corki Jhin Rumble Nid Karma (hard cc vs virtually no cc?)

or

(Kai'Sa/Galio/Alistar/Lee Sin/Nautilus) vs Ashe Graves Syndra Leona Fiora (still not fair)

or

(Kai'Sa/Taric/Rammus/Shen) vs Ahri Vel'Koz Zac (again...)

**tldr:** is she heavily or just moderately ally pick-dependent? (compared to say... Yasuo or something like that?)

Kai'Sa definitely shines when setup by allied CC, and I'd consider her highest synergy Supports to be Leona/Alistar/Thresh, champions that have multiple instances of hard CC to proc her passive and give her opportunities make use of her burst potential in lane. I don't think ranged supports are necessarily bad for her though, as she often just wants to survive lane and the general increased laning presence from a ranged support is sometimes a more consistent way to get through lane than hoping you can find all-ins.
Later in the game its definitely nice if you have teamfight CC setup like Malphite/Rakan to followup on, but I'd say she is generally powerful at this stage of the game regardless.

Has it been considered that maybe it's not Kai'sa being too weak and rather ADCs on average being far too strong at laning.

It used to be that you wouldn't even dream of taking an ADC into a bruiser or a mage because those classes just did better early, now champs like Lucian and Corki can frequently bully midlaners without really having any of the weaknesses of old early game mages who dropped off far harder.
I think there are certain characters that are far too generalist and good in every scenario bottom lane (Trist/Xayah in particular)
How does the 6 second vision denial affect Nocturne's team fighting power?

Nocturne ultimate already took a lot of mindshare from the enemy squishies, anticipating an all in. An additional two seconds will only increase that amount of pressure. Plus, having another two seconds to re-cast your Paranoia gives you more agency to pick and choose your target.
Do any of you guys play Juggernauts?  What are your feelings on them right now, from balance to enjoyment?

I do play Juggernauts, mostly Illaoi and Urgot but I do play all the others to some degree as well. Feelings on them is that while some are individually strong and good in the current meta, they don't have great itemization across the board though there are some exceptions (Illaoi is perfectly happy with her build path as is). As far as enjoyment goes, I think Darius and Illaoi are hitting the mark but Urgot feels a little off right now - which probably has to do with the current toplane meta being mostly matchups he's not super happy about. 

Depending on how broad your definition of Juggernaut is, you might also consider champions like Volibear, Trundle, and Yorick as well. They are doing well and in my opinion are all quite strong - Voli and Trundle are even competitively viable and Yorick is probably not far off. They all seem to be doing well on enjoyment too. At least in my personal experience I quite enjoy all of them right now, though I wouldn't pick Trundle or Yorick blind at the moment given the toplane meta. As counterpicks they feel quite good.

With regards to the Ahri changes, have you folks had opportunities to playtest the two-so-far iterations? If so, what do you think about them so far? Do they feel good to use, are the W changes enough to make it feel good? Is it skill expressive now?

Separate question, do you think that Fizz could work in the jungle? I had a really bad time of it the other day but I'd really like for it to work.

On Fizz in the jungle: it's something that used to be okay-ish with his old W, but doesn't work very well with the new W. Personally I really miss it being a "bad but playable" strategy, though it's not something that anyone really wants to buff due to concerns about the gameplay patterns of jungle Fizz - he's a strong roaming midlaner that is normally tied to a lane which limits his ability to snowball the map due to the constraints of his waveclear/experience. Without those restrictions on being in a lane, as a jungler, Fizz would likely need his ultimate cooldown nerfed or his ability to access targets (via R or EQ) toned down because he could simply make plays on the map consistently without risking his levels/turret by abandoning lane. 

Granted, all of those things are conditional upon his clearspeed being fast enough to compete with more standard junglers (which it never has been), but that's the kind of thing designers are concerned about when roaming assassins pop up in the jungle. You might notice that the assassins that function in the jungle (Kha'zix, Rengar, Evelynn) either have worse target access than Fizz (Kha'zix) or higher reliability that's significantly more gated (Rengar, Evelynn).

No problem!

I've been playtesting Ahri:

> Do they feel good to use, are the W changes enough to make it feel good? Is it skill expressive now?

I personally really like where we ended up at. I disliked the 5 dashes at sixteen model, but I feel like the higher-risk-higher-reward style that Ahri can take with the current list is both more fun & more satisfying than Live Ahri, who mostly just gets by as a neutralizer (meaning she doesn't kill her lane opponent without a gank, but she's also incredibly frustrating/hard to gank)

I don't think W feels amazing (or will ever feel that amazing without some more resources put into it) , but it chunking a bit harder feels like a worthy trade for a small delay on an ability which always feels kind of limp IMO.
How do you guys feel about playing vs the LB revert

Felt fine about it so far. Have had a couple cases where the burst has surprised me but I'm pretty sure that it's just something I'll get used to - live LB doesn't have much upfront damage so it's a change but not one I'm upset by.
whats your thoughts on kai'sa. i think her kits inability to lane might make her have a high mastery curve but she might just be weak right now too.

I see a lot of feedback that her laning might be too weak, and I wouldn't be surprised if we needed to buff that in some capacity as there's been other systemic changes that have hurt soft laning bot laners (Mainly the Fleet Footwork nerfs). That said, it's far too early to tell as it's the first day of the patch. I also get a bit salty as I believe that streamers/pros take their opinions of champions after far too few games.
i feel like if her laning is weak it might be hard to fix due to her kit just seeming bad in lane in general.
I think there are good levers personally -- Q CD, health regen & mana regen all affect the way she interacts with minion waves pretty substantially.

She needs a slight auto attack range increase imo.  Because she doesn't have reliable poke she has to rely on autos, but you can't really get close pre 6. I personally don't even think Riot knows how to play as her. They say she's auto attack focused but two of her abilities scale really well, and make her feel like a burst champ but, her abilities (outside R and the passive) are total trash. Q never hits the target you think it will and you have to be within your short ass auto range to even use it. W is really only useful if the monkeys on the enemy team afk so the incredibly slow speed of the projectile can possibly reach them before they return from their afk quest. E takes so long to "charge" that it doesn't feel that strong during fights that aren't premeditated. I don't feel she's weak or strong, just meh in lane, and if you're just meh in lane, you've already lost.

personally  i think that if they made her q prioritize marked targets then she could be good. as it stand her q is almost useless in skirmishes in minion wave, and down bot almost every fight is in a minion wave, at least if they do this they could make her keep a kind of all in assassin playstyle without giving more range and changing her identity.
What would you guys do to fix Karma's issue of using pretty much only one mantra (mainly) depending on what role she goes?

If we were to approach changing Karma from the perspective of "we want her to have more variety in what R she uses," there would be a few different ways to go about it from what I can see. The easiest (and also least interesting, in my opinion) way to do this would be to make the the different Mantras more similar - like putting a small haste on RW, a spellvamp effect (or other type of heal) on EQ, etc. The less difference there is between the Mantras, the less it matters which one is used - which likely increases variety, though not in a way I'd personally like.

Another (more interesting) way to go about this is to sort of "equalize" the different Mantras for the roles. That would mean putting more scaling power into RQ so that support Karma would be more likely to use it outside laning phase, moving RW's power away from being as selfish as it is now (with the %missing heal) and more into cc or damage to encourage support/mage Karma to use it and tank Karma to use other Mantras, and moving RE away from just being the most universally powerful when grouped (maybe less shielding/speed on allies and more into the main target shield/haste) so that support Karma doesn't feel as bad about not using it and more selfish builds might be more likely to use it.

**Assassins & Tanks Game Health**

_I would love to see assassins played on LCS._

You say you are buffing them as they are in a weak spot right now, but I read from a lot of you that you actually hate them and don't want to see them played. And then you also are going to nerf duskblade the incoming patch and you have made huge buffs to the old favorite of yours ryze and the like with the new ap itemization. I am frankly starting to think you just buff based on what you play and like not considering what it is helpful and healthy for the game overall.

I admittedly have been playing this game only for few years, but I have never seen assassins played in pro, like ever. Maybe a fizz or an ekko slips through but that's about it. And I don't say that they should be played all the time, but that they should be played in the right circumstances. For instance the opposite team is made of 3-4 squishies it SHOULD be viable to pick an assassin then and make it work and not the same mage in the midlane ALL THE TIME. This would make the game "healthier" as you can actually play all the champs depending on the opposite team comp, as you so often express as your ideal goal...
Assassins are the most mechanics/skill based champs and seeing pro playing them would be really fun and exciting and it would make the game way more fun to watch.

Pro is boring to watch. The team fighting comps are the most viable and win the most and this implies the use of at least 2 to 3 tanks. Tanks are ridiculously overpowered right now and I believe it is once again to be able to protect your beloved squishies in the midline or botlane. Tanks have a lot of CC and it is actually stupid sometimes how hard it is to kill them, like 5 players ulting on them to see them drop below 50% health. They should have strength and weaknesses as other classes do. 
Assassins are mobile, very strong at picking one player, but they lack team fight sustain and tankiness. Fair. 
Tanks have sustain, resistance, CC, mobility, and just _rarely_ lack some raw damage (indeed look at same of the many tanks with ridiculously unfair high damage like sion, cho or galio, or as another example look at the healthy speed of sej jg clear) which is anyway often replaced with % health damage or the like. In addition tanks are the least skill based champs as with other classes you would be punished heavily if caught in a bad spot, whereas they can often shrug it off their shoulders and be fine. If this is not enough, if tanks for some weird miracle are behind, they still remain a viable CC machine, whereas other classes would be left useless the rest of the game. This is what an overpowered class looks like and how it ruins a game. They should have some weakness like decrease their % health damage or their CC potential based on how much health they have, I don't know, I am a MD not a designer so I leave it to you to figure out. I understand your point of "if not op, nobody would play tanks", but I believe players would still play tanks in the right team comps and when they see fit (also in soloq), AS IT SHOULD BE and not all the time as it is right now.

I really hope you can read this and not just another TL;DR as I share and express the view of many other players who love this game.

Toodles
{{sticker:katarina-love}}

In Patch Chat, we like to be as transparent as possible with you guys on what we like and dislike. It's fun for us to chat with you guys about our game feels. Playtesters who are fond of mages may communicate that they're not fond of Assassin play patterns (because they're frustrating to play against if you're an immobile mage). Players who are AD mains may express distress with champions like Rengar or Zed. But, to a certain extent,  we definitely aspire to have most of our team play, (or have played), most champions in the game a large amount. In the case of Assassins, myself and Madness Heroo are both fairly familiar with Assassin play patterns; myself more so than him. I'm a big advocate of Assassins having agency to be able to assassinate targets and actively try to keep them in mind when assisting in providing feedback with the projects that I'm working on.

There may be a fundamental misunderstanding in why Assassins may not see professional play. **My personal read**: Assassins as a class function better in environments with low vision control & less coordination; the antithesis to professional play. Additionally, ADC and Support are fairly powerful in the current state of the game. A solution could be to, reduce the power of ADC's and Supports to give Assassins more agency and allow them to be picked in competitive. I'm not confident that this alone would be able to solve the aforementioned issue that Assassins suffer from. I'd argue that if Assassins were frequently played in competitive, that they're likely to be game warping in a solo queue environment, which in turn is arguably unhealthy for the game.

Tanks are certainly pretty prevalent right now in pro (Skarner/Sejuani/Zac in jungle) (Sion & Cho'Gath in top lane, with other champs mixed in). The Cinderhulk changes in 8.5 may potentially affect jungle picks and there are already jungle picks such as Kha'Zix & Jax in the jungle, and Gnar & GP in top lane that are played frequently and aren't exactly "tanks". I do think that the aforementioned champions are pretty powerful right now and I expect that they will, overtime with the changes that we're shipping out, likely see less play in exchange for more bruisers or carry junglers.

Sorry about the late response!
